title: CUDA Libraries Not Loading; Follow Up to #1346
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

After attempting to update to the new 2.2 release noted, I got a previously existing issue I had fixed in issue #1346.
In issue #1346 I had an issue in which the cuda libraries were not installed as an error for the 2.2rc1 release. However, now I have an issue where I tried updating to 2.2.0 (the most recent update that came out 10 days ago I believe?) it only updated to 2.2rc3 and recreated the same error. I have tried reinstalling cudatoolkit with the command mentioned in the previous issue a few times but still no avail. I tried other versions too but regardless it won't eliminate the error. Is 2.2rc3 the latest version?
What I was expecting was being able to update to 2.2.0 and not have the error pop up again; however, I'm uncertain if I installed the right information/toolkit

### Operating System

Windows 10

### DeepLabCut version

2.2rc3; trying to update

### DeepLabCut mode

single animal

### Device type

Geforce GTX 1080 Ti

### Steps To Reproduce

1) In the environment DLC-GPU, run ipython in the terminal
2)Next, import deeplabcut.     _Cuda toolkit error about the libraries pops up immediately_
3)deeplabcut.__version__     _This then tells me the version is 2.2rc3_
4)pip install "deeplabcut[gui]"  _The output from this says all issues are met and no updates were done at all_

### Relevant log output

```shell

2021-08-16 21:26:44.076174: I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cudart_stub.cc:29] Ignore above cudart dlerror if you do not have a GPU set up on your machine.
```

### Anything else?

Sorry for reopening an issue that was closed; last time the recommended line worked and this time it did not for some reason and it reappeared while updating. Any help would be much appreciated! I also might be misreading the releases and noting that the new release might be needing to be installed differently.
